You are about to create a new review round for this submission. Files that have not been used in other review rounds are listed below. By default, the reviewers from the previous review round have been selected to participate in this new review round.
Revised files uploaded by author (or editor) are listed here, with the editor checking (✔) them, prior to selecting an action for them.

Any files that have already been uploaded to any submission stage (even Editorial or Production) can be chosen for review by checking the Include checkbox below and clicking Search: all available files will be listed and can be chosen for inclusion. Additional files not already uploaded to a stage can be added to this listing by clicking the Upload Review File link.
This stage begins with editor using Select Files to identify the submission files for review.

The editor uses Add Reviewer to invite readers to review the submission files. When a reviewer downloads a submission file, a check box appears, which is checked (✔) when the review is submitted. The editor checks (✔) the reviews after consulting them. Reminders can be sent to reviewers by clicking on the two-balloon icon or unchecked box.
Include all files from all accessible workflow stages.

Any files that have already been uploaded to any submission stage can be added to the Final Draft Files listing by checking the Include checkbox below and clicking Search: all available files will be listed and can be chosen for inclusion. Additional files not already uploaded to a stage can be added to the listing by clicking the Upload A Final Draft link.

To add a participant to this stage of the submission, select a user group from the drop-down menu, then add a user.

Note: The user will be added to all stages for which this user group is assigned.
You are about to remove this participant from all stages. If the user also have pending auditor tasks, they will be removed too.

After reviewing the submission, the editor selects the appropriate action, which is accompanied by an author notification: Internal Review (leads to selecting files for review within the press); or External Review (leads to selecting files to be sent out for review); Accept Submission (leads to selecting files, without further review, for Editorial stage); or Decline Submission (archives submission).

This stage involves the copyediting and production of a fair copy of the submission. The editor, after assessing the fair copy files and as the final step for this stage, sends these files to Production.

The editor uses Select Files to identify the files ready for copyediting. The assigned copyeditor downloads these files and copyedits them. For edited volumes, this may mean breaking the submission up into discrete chapters for chapter-authors to review the copyedits, which are uploaded in Copyediting Files.

The copyeditor uploads the copyedited final draft files here, before inviting the author (and others) to “audit” the copyedits and answer queries. The check box that appears under Audit and in the auditor’s row is checked (✔) when the copyedit review is completed. The copyeditor checks (✔) the copyedit reviews after consulting them, and prepares a clean copy of the submission for uploading to Fair Copy Files.
The copyeditor uploads a clean or fair copy of the submission for review by the editor, prior to sending it to Production.

All approved and copyedited submission files from the Editorial stage are available in the Production Ready section. Different formats (digital, hardback, paperback/softback) can be configured for this submission in the Publication Formats section. The submission is considered complete when the Catalog Entry metadata has been approved, and all Publication Formats checklist items are marked complete.
The layout editor prepares these files for each of the selected Publication Formats, before uploading them in Proofreading for each format.

Different publication formats, such as hardcover, softcover and digital, can be uploaded in the Publication Formats section below. You can use the publication formats grid below as a checklist for what still needs to be done to publish a publication format.

Add one or more publication formats (eg. hardback; softback/paperback; digital; audio) here. Upload final galley proofs for each publication format below, and audit and approve them. For the galley to be listed in the public catalog, approve the Catalog Entry metadata and ensure that each format checklist item has been completed.

This stage involves a review of the submission by members of, or those associated with, the press. The editor, after assessing the internal reviews and as the final step for this stage, selects the appropriate action, which is accompanied by an author notification: Request Revisions (for the editor alone to review); Resubmit for Review (initiates a second round of internal reviews); External Review (leads to selecting of files for external review); Accept for Submission (leads to selecting files for Editorial Stage); or Decline Submission (archives submission).

This stage involves a review of the submission by relevant expert readers external to the press. After assessing the external reviews and as the final step for this stage, the editor selects the appropriate action, which is accompanied by an author notification: Request Revisions (for the editor alone to review); Resubmit for Review (initiates a second round of external reviews); Accept Submission (leads to selecting files for Editorial Stage); or Decline Submission (archives submission).
